summary: This bill, the "New Authorities Reforming Counter-narcotic Operations Act of 2025" (NARCO Act of 2025), amends the State Department Basic Authorities Act of 1956. It modifies the responsibilities of the Assistant Secretary for International Narcotics and Law Enforcement Affairs, shifting their reporting structure, and outlining new duties. These include coordinating international narcotics, anti-crime, and law enforcement affairs, combating transnational criminal organizations and terrorism, strengthening foreign justice systems, training foreign law enforcement, issuing rewards, coordinating with various government agencies, and developing program evaluation metrics. The bill prioritizes countering transnational criminal and terrorist organizations that threaten US national security.
